title: Under God ELIZABETH TENETY, EDITOR; Blogging on religion, government and politics
body:
Gays, like everyone else, are created in God's image 

      In Genesis 1:26-28, God creates humanity "after our likeness," and so humanity, male and female, is created in 
God's own image. . . .

So, we need to ask ourselves in what way are gay men, lesbians, bisexuals or transgendered people not in the 
image of God in this interpretation of the text? How are gay people deficient in being creative, engaging the world, 
other humans and, most important, God, and the God-given work of caring for all living things? . . .

There is no "wrongness" in being gay in the Christian perspective, not because DNA evidence tells us that being 
gay is very likely rooted in one's genetic code, but because gay men, lesbians, bisexuals and transgendered people 
are created in the image of God. In the Christian theological perspective they are fully and completely human 
beings in their relationship with other humans and the God who created them.

 -- Susan Brooks Thistlethwaite, professor, Chicago Theological Seminary 

Staff writers Michelle Boorstein and William Wan and "On Faith" editor Elizabeth Tenety blog regularly on 
religion, politics and policy at http://washingtonpost.com/onfaith.
